title: Push notifications spam even after turning them off
text: Linkedin in an effort to drive engagement has started sending too many spam notifications. They have a made a complex web of notification alerts and even after disabling ‚ÄòEvent alerts‚Äô they keep sending push notifications

title: Fine Down Hill - Cost Doesn‚Äôt Match the Offerings
text:
-Glitches every week
-Constant freezing and shutdowns/no server response
-Candiste Pool is smaller, less technical and most search customizations aren‚Äôt as effective as they should be when eliminating criteria
-Finding more qualifies talent by searching in my personal LinkedIn strings
-Just not worth it anymore and no one can do anything bc there are no other platforms as mainstreamed for professional.

title: Horrible Customer Service
text: I‚Äôm locked out of this app. Users can get no help unless they login. What a horrible experience. I‚Äôm thankful that my career does not require me to access my contacts.

title: Love LinkedIn but
text: But the app itself is so slow and really buggy. Scroll bar keeps getting stuck when reading articles or job descriptions.

title: Difficulty negotiating Linkedn platform
text:
I was asked to install a newer version of Linkedn, but was not given any path to do this.  I tried to contact customer service,  but got nowhere- This ended in a second dead end. 

David Min
650 421-5488 (cell)

title: Fix please
text: I‚Äôm tired of receiving the same notifications! I‚Äôve already commented and liked them and they still keep popping up as new notifications!

title: Bad company
text: Can not get into my account for months and they keep giving me problems to use this for networking.

title: Unsubscribe
text: It will not let me unsubscribe!!! I don‚Äôt need or want any job offers. I have gotten a job!!!

title: Bugs
text: Lot of bugs, unable to scroll smoothly

title: Fine app but job search needs a lot of help
text:
Looking for a job is much easier on other apps. 

The biggest issue that I run across constantly is one company posting the same job a million times and LinkedIn thinking I want to see and hear about every single one. They can take up pages of the job search page. 

It‚Äôs impossible to block companies or else I would so I would see these jobs. 

If they add the ability to block or hide companies jobs, then it would make this so much better. But as it is now, it‚Äôs a frustrating experience.

title: Thanks for locking out older iPhone users
text: Update doesn‚Äôt work on iPhone 6S. And no, not upgrading so I can get LinkedIn app. App was getting too too heavy anyway.

title: Notification abuse
text: I intentionally disable specific notifications. LinkedIn decides to start sending me new ones anyway. So now I‚Äôve permanently and completely disabled all notifications. That‚Äôs what happens when you continually disrespect your customer‚Äôs choices.

title: Unable to login
text: Keeps saying my captcha response is missing or invalid but pretty sure I got it right. Even tried the audio one and still getting the same results.

title: This site can eat a KCID
text: They suspend me over and over and over again. I will never pay for a premium subscription ever again. #freepalestine #fromtherivertothesea üáµüá∏

title: Bug
text:
I can‚Äôt even sign on - keeps telling me my ‚Äúchallenge failed‚Äù when I never get the ‚Äúright side up‚Äù challenge to begin with.

All I do is enter in the mobile 2 factor code and then it fails every single time.

title: Impossible to reset my password
text:
Somehow Im logged in on my phone but my password on my keychain does not work. So i was happy to see authenticator is an option for sign on but to turn it on it wants to send me a code. The code does not seem to work on password reset. Ive tried having it send me a text and my backup email, both have failed. This is incredibly frustrating.

Update- a bunch of pins came in at once to my email, none of them work.  There is too great a delay for this.

title: Extra-Step Verification Process
text: The verification process has now caused me to have unusual activity across two emails as well as my phone number; Which has led to prevent me from making more google accounts to fix the initial problem. Now I am F‚Äôed, unable to use the app because the extra verification steps. My seeking to connect, through the widely recognized app to do so, has come to an end.

title: Bookmarks
text: Make the bookmarks easier to navigate to! Please and thank you

title: Latest Update Broke Everything
text: I was logged in -  but the recent update logged me out. No big deal. But now the app will not let me sign in. It thinks I haven‚Äôt downloaded the app, takes me to the App Store, I sign in, and it takes me back to the App Store to download the app. I‚Äôm ALREADY using the app to sign in - and it wants me to download it again? I click to open the app once I‚Äôm in the App Store (because I have already downloaded it) and it asks me to sign in once the app is open. Once I do - it sends me back to the App Store to download something that is already on my phone. I am stuck in an endless loop.

title: Sexist
text: Found the app/sight to be highly sexist and anti-man for some reason. No longer use them for our hiring purposes and ask that our partners no longer list with them either. Enough pandering, it‚Äôs business, we don‚Äôt have an agenda, we just want the best employees, just stop the pandering.

title: Awful app now
text: Terrible app when every post is ‚Äúsuggested‚Äù. Nobody wants to see this crap! Make it an optional feature

title: Sidebar bug
text: There‚Äôs a really annoying bug where opening the left sidebar freezes the app. I‚Äôve encountered this bug for months but it apparently has not been addressed. This renders the app practically useless. Please fix!

title: LinkedIn engages in profiling through barring certain searches
text:
While I have benefitted from certain services that LinkedIn provides such as LinkedIn learning, LinkedIn no longer appears to serve the individual user as much as it serves corporate recruiting efforts and corporate advertising. 

Additionally, the software app allows a user to see job listings for which the user is qualified, but it is not responsive to repeated requests not to see job ads from certain companies which a user has repeatedly requested the software to filter out of the lists to the user. Instead, it repeatedly promises not to show those job listing ads, but then proceeds to show them a day later anyway.
When will this be addressed properly?

title: Really this is app???
text: This is just webview component for website! Hahaha! Useless app

title: Optimization Dwindling
text: The mobile app is not UX-friendly for content managers; inability to view full metrics in page analytics and instead only shows the past 30 days is a joke. I understand this is a job posting website but functionality is incredibly lacking. Seems like they're getting comfortable being bad.

title: Contact Section is very bad UXD
text:
I am a visual designer and people often send me messages asking where my portfolio link and other info are. I have to tell them, and if they ask, my info is under my name and job title - in the Contact section!

That Contact section is very important - it needs to be easily discoverable by others. It needs to be supafast to find a summary and links without having to find my resume. The name, surname and job titles dominating Contact section and this makes it hidden.

Please improve it!

title: Happening Now
text: A zero star review

title: Job application
text: I was very impressed how quick my resume reached the application that I applied for. Regards, Kendall Bennett

title: Deleted my account
text: Removed me for no reason after only having it for one day.

title: terrible service
text: people don‚Äôt hire on this app. point blank. even if you have credentials that meet that of the employers you apply for, 99% reject you anyway. apply through the company sites  to see results. I cannot stress this enough, do not use this app

title: Needs Bug Fixes
text: Every time that I click on my profile the app freezes. This makes the app virtually useless. I cannot post, see my network, go to settings, etc. I have to go in on my desktop. I will update once/if fixed.

title: Search box has been busted for years and LinkedIn doesn‚Äôt care
text: If you type too quickly and hit enter while searching for something, LinkedIn will search for the LAST thing you had searched for instead of what you just typed. There‚Äôs some kind of front end animation bug that doesn‚Äôt let what you just typed end up in your search query. Looks like hitting enter sends the api request for your last query because the front end is waiting for the animation to finish before it sends off your api request with the new search parameter‚Ä¶

title: Great for networking‚Ä¶ until it locks you out
text: This app is fantastic when it works. But when it doesn‚Äôt, the customer support is absolutely TERRIBLE. Right after I bought premium LinkedIn, the app kicked me out and asked me to do a security check. I have provided my ID probably 10-15 times now to no avail. Now, they are also asking for my proof of residency. I provided that over 2 weeks ago and still have heard nothing from them. The customer support is hard to reach and you cannot even call a number to get help. I‚Äôve been kicked out of LinkedIn for over a month now, all while trying to search for a job. If my account ever gets unbanned, I would rate LinkedIn as 2 stars. It would get all 5 if this experience was not so frustrating but this has been the worst customer support that I have ever seen.

title: Cannot log in
text: I just bought a new phone and download LinkedIn, and when I tried to log in, it first prompted that it wanted to make sure it‚Äôs me, so asked to send verification code to my phone or another email address. Then after I choose either option, it will return to the log in page and asked to said it sent the verification code on my LOGIN EMAIL ADDRESS. I have been into this loop for 5 times. PLZ FIX IT.

title: Frustrated
text: I need help changing the old Apple ID to my new one so I can update the app. In addition it is a nightmare to find a nickname to even post a review. Extremely frustrating. An option should be given to enter both your Apple ID and password instead of just your password.

title: Depressing that I can‚Äôt rate 0 stars
text: Once downloaded I made an account. This account was immediately ‚Äúrestricted‚Äù with no reasoning and I‚Äôm not allowed to make a second account with a different email. Waste of time, waste of storage, honestly one of the stupidest things I‚Äôve ever come across.

title: Never got a job on this app
text: Super expensive monthly app, it‚Äôs about $720 a year! Plus they constantly try to send you emails saying someone viewed your profile, then link to a blurry picture every time. What exactly is my $720 dollars paying for. Premium never got me a job..Any job I have applied for always says ‚Äòpay for premium to see how you compare to the 300 other applicants‚Äù Any job you apply to there is never less then 100 applicants. I have never gotten a call back from a Linkdn job. Some people talk about networking on Linkdn. Maybe for some it‚Äôs definitely not my world. I network more on apps that aren‚Äôt $60 a month. Do better

title: Trash app, full of bugs as well as endless ads
text:

Endless ads and nothing worthy and spams. Its worse than instagram now 

And whenever i add someone you cant tell if it‚Äôs still pending because even if the invitation says pending if you get the contact in your recommended list  l it adds as if i never added before .

And the developers ignore the reveiws and show the positive ones from three years back

What a trash app

title: Stuck when I click my profile
text: Been this way for months with iPhone 15. Huge bug . Once I click on my profile the side menu is stuck and I have to reset the app. Stupid

title: Layout for articles is bad
text: Love the app, but don‚Äôt love the new layout for articles. They used to show up as image tiles, now they‚Äôre tiny images with large headlines. It looks terrible, please go back to the old layout for articles!

title: App is Broken
text: Eveyrtime you try to get to profile/settings on iphone 14 pro it freezes.

title: Security Check
text: Won‚Äôt allow me to get past the security check on the app. I entered the wrong email on the site and it won‚Äôt even allow me to change it. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend trying to find a job here‚Ä¶.

title: Full of Liars
text: This is the worst job board app or website I‚Äôve seen. It is full of job postings that are full of lies are misinformation, and LinkedIn has zero interest in holding these companies accountable. It is very common to see a job posting with the label of ‚Äúentry level‚Äù but the company then goes on to say, but actually you need 2+ years prior experience, which is 2+ years away from being an entry level job. Or a job that says in the title $30-$35 an hour. But then in the description the company says you can make ‚Äúup to $20 an hour‚Äù. Not only does this app not have a way to report these, they ignore your email when you take the extra time to tell them about it. Thus, it odd evident that they don‚Äôt care what the companies say on their job postings, as long as the sheep keep using the app.

title: Scrolling issues
text: Numerous issues with freezing when trying to scroll, particularly in the jobs tab. Please fix

title: Please remove the ‚Äòcatch up‚Äô tab from my network
text: The new catch up tab in my network is a very noisy update and completely ruins the importance of the My Network tab. I‚Äôve contacted support but I received no reply. Please remove the catch up tab

title: 347ZARLINO
text: At gmail dot com

title: API calls make UI stall
text: EDIT: v9.1.343 is still wildly broken. Now touch events often stop working when you scroll on the main feed. If you scroll past something, stop and scroll back you‚Äôll end up scrolling past it up then down, then up, then down, then up ‚Äî you will not be able to stop the scroll on the post you want to see unless you set your phone down an take a deep breath in between each scroll. This app was QA‚Äôed by a donut. Extremely buggy on iOS on iPhone 12 max. I‚Äôve deleted the app and reinstalled. There‚Äôs some very badly managed API calls that feel like it‚Äôs using jQuery instead of a modern MVC framework causing every other scroll to click instead. I don‚Äôt understand why it became so much worse, or how QA engineers let this out the door. It‚Äôs very badly managed developers and software. This was not an issue at all a couple years ago, shortly after Microsoft bought LinkedIn. It is however unsurprising that the UI became much worse after MS got involved and MS has no design cycle nor do they have a QA cycle so it‚Äôs absolutely likely the UI will continue to get worse. Sigh, hopefully I‚Äôll land a job so I don‚Äôt need to use this broken and frustrating UI much longer. The most frustrating part it I tried to tell LinkedIn and the customer support claimed the couldn‚Äôt replicate, which is funny because I tested on several iPhones. It‚Äôs gaslighting on their part. The whole customer support experience also reminded e of Microsoft, where thy just don‚Äôt believe you and assume the customer is doing something wrong. I don‚Äôt think they want to fix it.
